alert.note: Alert for Dundy; Hitchcock (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued May 11 at 2:22PM CDT until May 11 at 2:45PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: The National Weather Service in Goodland has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Southwestern Hitchcock County in southwestern Nebraska... Southeastern Dundy County in southwestern Nebraska... * Until 145 PM MDT/245 PM CDT/. * At 122 PM MDT/222 PM CDT/, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 12 miles northwest of Ludell, or 12 miles south of Trenton, moving northwest at 30 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * Locations impacted include... Stratton. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
